page.title: 02THOROUGHFARES ON MARK MOOR
page.content: Roads dividing this area are all unclassified straight with right angled corners, dividing the land into roughly equal sections. Wide grass verges & deep ditches on both sides & in some cases lines of willow or poplar trees. Droves are wide grassy tracks giving access to fields not served by roads. Most are wide enough to allow 2 vehicles to pass one another. Generally straight with ditches & hawthorn hedges on both sides. Delightful for walking in summer but become rutted & sometimes impassable in winter. Excellent habitat for wildlife animals & plants. Farmers maintain the droves on their own land. Lanes none in this area. Footpaths are numerous & can be found on the O.S.maps, most are used & kept in reasonable order.
